articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
reports that colorful events have taken place in different 
countries to celebrate the 55th birthday of Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   Under the headline "Immortal annals which added lustre to 
the 20th century", the paper carries an article stressing 
that Secretary  Kim Jong Il, born as son of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung, who was the leader of the Paektusan 
guerrillas, is another General gifted with characters of Mt. 
Paektu.
   Papers carry news that 180,000 workers of 170 unions 
under the "Korean Confederation of Trade Unions" went on a 
strike. Also seen in the press is news of the strikes of 
workers and other people in south Korea and brisk 
international solidarity movements.
   Printed in Rodong Sinmun is a press statement issued by a 
spokesman for the DPRK Committee for Investigation into 
Damage Caused  by the Japanese Imperialists' Occupation of 
Korea, denouncing the remarks of the former director general 
of the management and coordination agency of Japan 
justifying its past crime of aggression.
   The chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the National 
Democratic Front of South Korea published a statement as 
regards the south Korean people's struggle against the 
retrogressive amendment of the fascist laws, says the paper.
   Papers in commentaries brand tuesday's "ruling-opposition 
talks", called by the traitor Kim Young Sam in connection 
with the revised "law on the agency for national security 
planning" and "labour laws", as a clumsy political drama of 
a hypocrite.
   An article of Rodong Sinmun calls for an intensified 
struggle against dominationism, exposing its essence and 
virus.

articles.title: 180,000 s. Korean workers on strikes
articles.content:
180,000 S. Korean workers on strikes
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- South Korean workers 
continued strikes on Wednesday in protest against the 
retrogressively revised "labor law", according to radio 
reports from Seoul.
   Some 180,000 workers of 170 unions under the "Korean 
Confederation of Trade Unions" (Minjurochong), the 
Federation of Trade Unions for Hyundai Group Subsidiaries 
(Hyunchongryon), the federation of metal workers' unions and 
the federation of office workers' unions included, went on 
overall or partial strikes, in the morning, urging the 
abrogation of the "law".
   Minjurochong declared that such Wednesday general strikes 
will continue till February 18 to have the "law" amended to 
suit the international standards.
   More than 10,000 unionised workers under the umbrella of 
the labor group held a rally at Jongmyo Park in Seoul for a 
general strike against the revision of the "law", urging the 
traitor Kim Young Sam to rewrite the "law" immediately.
   The chairman of the labor group, Kwon Yong Gil, told the 
rally that if the "government" fails to begin amending  the 
"law" again till February 17, the fourth stage of the 
general strike involving the public sector will be started 
on February 18. He then urged the ruling and opposition 
camps to reamend the "labor law" till March 1 as demanded by 
Minjurochong.
   After the rally, they took to the street and made a 
march, chanting slogans for the abrogation of the evil law.
   An estimated 10,000 workers under Hyunchongryon met in 
Ulsan calling for the nullification of the "labor law" and 
vowing to continue the strike until their demand is met.
   118 priests belonging to the "national priests' group of 
the Korean Holy Catholic Church" made public a statement 
saying that as the railroading through the "national 
assembly" of the "labor law" and the "law on the agency for 
national security planning" was not agreeable not only with 
the people's desire but with the "parliament law", the 
"government" and the ruling Party must repeal the evil laws 
and apologize for their retrogressive revision.
   On Tuesday, some 200 religionists belonging to Roman 
Catholic, Christian, buddhist and one other religious groups 
gathered and vowed to launch a campaign for the repeal of 
the "laws" with concerted efforts, transcending their 
religious belief.

articles.title: NDFSK demands withdrawal of evil laws
articles.content:
NDFSK demands withdrawal of evil laws
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The National Democratic 
Front of South Korea (NDFSK) will deal a sledge-hammer blow 
at the Kim Young Sam group by escalating resistance together 
with 10 million workers and other patriotic people. 
   Ri Jong Sang, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the NDFSK 
said this in a statement issued on Jan. 22 in connection 
with the nationwide struggle of south Korean people from all 
walks of life against the revised "labor laws" and "law on 
the agency for national security planning".
   He went on:
   "The NDFSK and south Korean people will overthrow the 
kim Young Sam group, a band of flunkeyist traitors and 
rare fascists, by the flame of the nationwide resistance. 
   "We strongly urge the Kim Young Sam group to 
stop fascist suppression of the just struggle of south 
Korean people against the 'labor laws' and 'law on the 
agency for national security planning'  revised in favour of 
big business, withdraw all the fascist laws and step 
down from power before they are overthrown by the strength 
of the indignant popular masses."

articles.title: Papers on appeasement and deception of Kim Young Sam group
articles.content:
Papers on appeasement and deception of Kim Young Sam group
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The traitor Kim Young Sam 
and a spokesman for the "New Korea Party" at the "talks 
between opposition and ruling parties" held on January 21 
refused to meet the demand for nullification of the 
unilateral "law on the agency for national security 
planning" and "labor laws" and took issue with the 
opposition parites.
   Rodong Sinmun says in a commentary today that this 
clearly shows once again that the traitor Kim and his "NKP" 
clan have no intention to rewrite the fascist laws as 
demanded by the people.  The analyst goes on:
   It is the height of impudence for the puppet traitor to 
talk about the "lawfulness" of the "laws" he and his "NKP" 
clan railroaded through the "national assembly" in the 
absence of the opposition lawmakers in violation of the 
"national assembly law".
   Such act does not "conform with" the constitution. It is 
a political gangsterism of violating even elementary 
parliamentary democracy and bloodless coup d'etat.
   The puppet traitor contended that the retrogressive
revision of the laws the people set themselves against 
"conforms with the constitution", while the struggle of the 
people for their nullification "is a violation of the 
constitution". This is a reversed logic and the most vicious 
sophism that can be made by the fascist tyrant who has 
turned his back on the people.
   His statement that the "national  assembly may debate on 
the issue of rewriting the two  evil laws" is not aimed at 
rewriting them but to gain time, tide over the crisis 
and destroy the labor movement organisations one after 
another.
   Minju Joson says that it is only too natural that the 
"Korean Confederation of Trade Unions" and other labor 
movement organisations warned that they will mount a more 
powerful all-people struggle unless their demands for 
nullification of the evil laws are met.

articles.title: European headquarters of Pomminryon publishes appeal
articles.content:
European headquarters of Pomminryon publishes appeal
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The European headquarters 
of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification 
(Pomminryon) in an appeal to all the fellow countrymen 
called upon them to join in one mind in the nationwide 
struggle to check the moves for prolonging the Kim Young 
Sam dictatorial regime.
   The appeal called for joining the workers and patriots in 
the struggle braving suppression by the "government power" 
and the becoming  large one irrespective of the stand and 
understanding of their organisations and public bodies, for 
the historic mission of achieving national reunification.
   The European headquarters of Pomminryon on January 15 
staged a protest demonstration in front of the south Korean 
puppet consulate general in Berlin in support of the south 
Korean workers' struggle for repealing the evil laws. 
The demonstration continued on January 16.
   Korean compatriots, south Korean students studying in 
Germany, German metal trade unionists and other German 
citizens staged a demonstration, shouting slogans with the 
placards "kim Young Sam 'civilian-veiled' dictatorship, 
resign" and "We support struggle of south Korean workers" in 
their hands.
   The demonstrators made public a statement solidarizing 
the south Korean workers in the struggle against the evil 
laws.

articles.title: S. Korean labor union leaders on unreasonable  revision of labor law
articles.content:
S. Korean labor union leaders on unreasonable  revision of labor law
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Delegates of the "Korean 
Confederation of Trade Unions" and the "Federation of Korean 
Trade Unions" voiced objection to south Korea's "labor law" 
at a meeting of the Labor Consultative Committee of the 
Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) 
held in Paris on Tuesday, according to a radio report from 
Seoul.
   They said the "labor law", revised by the puppet clique 
in secret way, is an evil law trampling down the workers' 
elementary right to democray and other vital rights.
   The committee noted that the evil law is unsuitable to 
the international standards and urged OECD to criticize the 
south Korean puppet government.
   It also called for removal of articles prohibiting the 
formation of more than two unions at any one work site and 
the formation of teachers' unions.
   Meanwhile, delegates of south Korean businesses 
shamelessly defended the evil law, which has drawn worldwide 
fire, at a meeting of the oecd economic and industrial 
consultative committee.

articles.title: Recalling to my mind noble obligation
articles.content:
Recalling to my mind noble obligation
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun dated Jan. 
21 carried reminiscences "recalling to my mind noble 
obligation" written by mariya novichenko, widow of the late 
Ya. T. Novichenko, an internationalist soldier of the former 
Soviet Union.
   The reminiscences tells in detail about the deep love and 
solicitude shown by the great leaders President Kim Il Sung 
and Secretary Kim Jong Il to Novichenko and his family to 
repay an obligation.
   Novichenko, a second lieutenant of the former Soviet 
Union Red Army, was an internationalist soldier, who covered 
with his body a handgrenade at the platform of a celebration 
meeting in Pyongyang in March 1946 to safeguard the brain 
of the Korean revolution. Mariya wrote in her reminiscences:
   On his visit to the former Soviet Union in May 1984,  
President Kim Il Sung met Novichenko  at Novosibirsk railway 
station and highly praised  his obligatory deed as a heroic 
act.   
   President Kim Il Sung called my husband and family to 
Korea several times and showed benevolent love and 
solicitude to them like to family members.
   Novichenko used to say in his lifetime that the respected 
President Kim Il Sung is the benefactor and father of 
probity who bestowed glory upon him.  We will always 
remember the President down through generations.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il has always welcomed Novichenko and 
his family in Korea as guests of the state, made itinerary 
and sent them gifts and a birthday table.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a message of condolence and a 
wreath to  express  deep condolences over the death of 
Novichenko. He personally organised the work of  carrying on 
the instruction of the President to look for Novichenko and 
finally found him out, so that the President met him.
   A legend of noble obligation shown by 
President Kim Il Sung and Secretary  Kim Jong Il to my 
husband, who carried  out his duty as a soldier and was a 
foreign farmer, and to my family will be praised by all the 
people century by century.

articles.title: Korea's central task of economic construction this year
articles.content:
Korea's central task of economic construction this year
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Korea set it as the 
central task of socialist economic construction this 
year to tap and utilize the economic potentials to the 
maximum, decidedly solve the food problem, radically improve 
the people's standard of living, promote land administration 
and lay a solid foundation for the prosperity of the 
country. The rural economy is confronted with a task to do 
scientific and technical farming this year as demanded by 
the Juche method of farming and in keeping with the desire 
of the farmers and specific conditions and increase 
production of rice and meat.
   The agricultural workers who think that it is necessary 
to increase the fertility of soil  for the increased 
production of grain are making full preparations for this 
year's farming, including production of manure and its 
carriage to fields and the spreading of fertile soil on the 
fields. And with a view to increasing the production of meat 
they are extensively on creating grass fields and conducting 
all-people campaign to breed grass-eating domestic animals.
   The light industry is to direct great efforts to the 
production of mass consumer goods to more satisfactorily 
meet the growing demands of the people for light industrial 
goods. Factories and enterprises under the light industry 
commission and the ministry of local industries are 
effecting a new upswing in production this year.
   Factories under the associated bureau for the shoe-making 
industry registered a high record of 150 percent in the 
production of shoes in the recent one week as against the 
same period last year.
   Foreign trade should build up  export production bases 
and decisively increase production to advance into foreign 
markets.
   Innovations should be effected  in the pace-setting 
domain of the national economy, including coal and power 
industries and railway transport, and metal industry  
developed to properly meet the increasing demands.
   All the people should make a decisive progress in 
afforestation and river-improvement projects, road 
management and city administration to turn the mountains and 
fields of the country, streets and villages into a paradise 
of the people better to live in.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls for anti-dominationism struggle
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun calls for anti-dominationism struggle
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
carries an article titled "let us further intensify struggle 
against dominationism".
   Fighting against dominationism is an important task to 
safeguard the sovereignty and dignity of a country and a 
nation and make the whole world independent, the daily says, 
and continues:
   What is important in the struggle against dominationism 
is to totally reject illusion about imperialism.
   Illusion about the imperialists, dominationists can be 
removed only when each country maintains an independent 
stand. Each country should carry on the revolution and 
construction with a firm belief that its problems can be 
resolved by itself.
   In foreign relations, too, independence should be 
maintained and cooperation and solidarity strengthened on 
its basis.
   It is also important in the struggle to thwart the 
dominationists' activities to sow discord among other 
nations, answering them with strategy of unity.
   If the developing nations and all other anti-imperialist 
independent forces of the world put unity above anything 
else and struggle in close unity, irrespective of the 
difference in social system, political view and religious 
belief, the imperialists, the dominationists will become 
impotent and genuine peace can be ensured in the world.

articles.title: S. Korean workers' struggle supported worldwide
articles.content:
S. Korean workers' struggle supported worldwide
   Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The "Working Russia" 
movement held a mass rally in Moscow on Jan. 18 supporting 
the south Korean workers' struggle.
   V. Anpilov, chairman of the executive committee of 
the movement, and other speakers bitterly denounced the 
south Korean authorities' fascist suppression of the 
struggle of the south Korean workers.
   A decision was adopted at the rally to express full 
support and solidarity for the struggle of the south Korean 
workers and demand the puppet authorities withdraw the evil 
laws immediately.
   That day, the third conference of the "working capital" 
movement adopted a statement actively supporting and 
encouraging the massive protest of the south Korean workers 
and other people and denouncing the puppet clique, a herd 
of fascist gangsters and the united states and Japan which 
are continuously patronizing them, as proposed by Vladimir 
Gusev, chairman of the executive committee of the movement.
   Members of these movements staged a protest action in 
front of the south Korean puppet embassy in Moscow on Jan. 
19 and 20 and handed over a decision and a statement.
   The all-India Trade Union Congress in a statement on 
Jan. 15 strongly called for the abrogation of the new 
"labour laws" of south Korea.
   The all-India agricultural workers union published a 
statement on January 14 extending solidarity to the strikers 
in south Korea. The statement called upon all the workers in 
India to extend assistance, material and mental, to their 
just struggle.
   The  Chairman of the Federal Trade Union of Austria in a 
press statement on Jan. 16 said that the union strongly 
protested the action of the south Korean "government" and 
demanded an immediate stop to the ruthless arrest of labour 
union leaders and the bloody suppression of demonstrators.
   Dr. Friedebert Kollmann, Chairman of the Austrian 
Jurists' Union for the Defence of Democracy and Human Rights 
in South Korea, in a press statement on the same day 
expressed solidarity for the south Korean workers' struggle, 
saying that the behaviour of the south Korean "government" 
in violent suppression of their struggle cannot be tolerated 
in any case.
   The Zimbabwean National Committee for the Study of the 
Juche Idea, the Zimbabwe-Korea Solidarity and Friendship 
Association, the Yemen-Korea Friendship Association, the 
Mexico-DPRK Institute of Friendship and Cultural Interchange 
and the Ghana-DPRK Friendship Association sent letters to 
the "Korean Confederation of Trade Unions" in support of the 
strike of south Korean workers.

articles.title: DPRK official on Kim Young Sam's planned visit to Japan
articles.content:
DPRK official on Kim Young Sam's planned visit to Japan
  Pyongyang, January 23 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the 
Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries 
issued a statement today on the traitor Kim Young Sam's trip 
to Japan slated for late this month. The statement says:
   Why the traitor Kim Young Sam is going to visit Japan in 
the beginning of the year and at this time when the 
political situation of south Korea is totally paralysed 
draws international attention.
   He is in the most serious political and economic crisis 
in his term of office.
   As is known to all, the unprecedented general strike of 
south Korean workers against the retrogressive revision of 
the "law on the agency for national security planning" and 
the "labor law" by the Kim Young Sam puppet regime is 
developing into a serious political struggle for the ouster 
of Kim Young Sam and driving into catastrophe the south 
Korean economy saddled with last year's trade deficit of 23 
billion dollars and the foreign debt of some 100 billion 
dollars.
   The socalled "international cooperation system" is 
destined to break down, though Kim Young Sam has asked his 
masters and worked so hard for it, sometimes complaining to 
the masters.
   It is obvious that during his overseas trip, Kim Young 
Sam, forsaken at home and abroad, will beg Japan to remain 
in the "cooperation system" against the DPRK and to refrain 
from humanitarian assistance to the DPRK.
   He is mistaken if he thinks that will help him live in 
peace during the rest of his term.
   Even if he makes much ado abroad while being denied 
dialogue with the DPRK for his heinous crimes against the 
nation, no one will be affected. His trip reminds one of a 
bird looking for shelter after losing its nest.
   Whoever dances to the tune of Kim Young Sam or encourages 
his misconduct, if any, will also be criticized by the south 
Korean people and the world public as a third-rate 
politician and enemy of humanitarianism.
